content: Now turning to pre-tax pre-provision components of the income statement for the third quarter, tax equivalent net interest income was $155 million, which was up approximately $12.2 million or 8.6% from the second quarter, driven by higher interest income through average loan growth for the prior quarter, increases in loan yields due to higher market interest rates, and an additional day in the third quarter partially offset by lower PPP and purchase accounting accretion interest income and increases in deposit and borrowing costs.
